jparsec.graph

Class ChartSeriesElement

  • java.lang.Object
    • jparsec.graph.ChartSeriesElement
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class ChartSeriesElement
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Creates a series for later use in JFreeChart.

    In this object the legends can be encoded following the instructions given in TextLabel class. This provides some possibilities like to dynamically change color/size, include superscript or subscript text, or greek letters.

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    T. Alonso Albi - OAN (Spain)
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

        public ChartSeriesElement.REGRESSION regressionType
        To set the regression type. Constants defined in this class and in class GenericFit. If you use GenericFit you should previously check that the data can be fitted with a given function.

      • stroke

        public JPARSECStroke stroke
        Sets the stroke for the regression line.

      • pointers

        public java.lang.String[] pointers
        Sets the text to pointers in an x-y chart. Format is point number (in the order defined by the x array, being 1 the first point) plus the text to write. Pointers and labels are set automatically using the angle defined in another parameter (the pointers angle), although the value can be set in each pointer using the '@LEFT', '@RIGHT', '@UP', and '@DOWN' commands at the beginning of the pointer text. The command '@CENTERx', where x is a number between 1 and 9, can also be used to locate the text relative to the arrow when exporting to Gildas format.

        Another posible format to set a pointer in a given location (not towards a given point in the chart) is to replace the point number with '(x,y)' (without quotes), being x and y the pointer location in physical units.

      • pointersAngle

        public ChartSeriesElement.POINTER_ANGLE pointersAngle
        Sets an angle in radians to point the pointers. Can be set to one of the constants defined in this class. Default value is up.

      • showArrowInPointers

        public boolean showArrowInPointers
        To show or not arrows in pointers, yes by default.

      • showErrorBars

        public boolean showErrorBars
        True (default) to show error bars.

      • pointersLabelOffsetFactor

        public float pointersLabelOffsetFactor
        Sets the offset position factor for pointer labels. Should be between 0 and 2. 1 by default.

      • xMinimumValue

        public double xMinimumValue
        Sets minimum value of x. Useful for charts in log scale where error bars can reach negative values.

      • yMinimumValue

        public double yMinimumValue
        Sets minimum value of y. Useful for charts in log scale where error bars can reach negative values.

      • enable

        public boolean enable
        True to enable (show) this series, false to hide it. This is only supported on xy charts.

    • Method Detail

      • getPointers

        public static java.lang.String[] getPointers(java.lang.String comment)
        Gets the pointers from a string. They are defined as the point number plus an space and the text to write as the pointer. Instead of the point number it is possible to insert the point position in the format (x, y).
        Parameters:
        comment - Input string.
        Returns:
        Array of pointers.

      • getInstanceName

        public java.lang.String getInstanceName()

      • getSeriesFromDataSets

        public static ChartSeriesElement[] getSeriesFromDataSets(java.lang.String[] x,
                                         java.lang.String[] y,
                                         double[] dx,
                                         double[] dy,
                                         java.lang.String[] legends,
                                         boolean changeShape)
                                                  throws JPARSECException
        Returns a set of series for a given set of values for x, y, and their errors. The array of legends is used to identify to which series a given point belongs, so the number of series produced depends on the number of different elements in this array.
        Parameters:
        x - The array of x values.
        y - The array of y values.
        dx - The array of x errors. Can be null.
        dy - The array of y errors. Can be null.
        legends - The array of legends for each point.
        changeShape - True to change the shape for each series, false to change the color.
        Returns:
        The array of series.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • getShape

        public static int getShape(java.awt.Shape shape)
        Return the index of certain shape in the array of available ones.
        Parameters:
        shape - A shape.
        Returns:
        The index of the shape which is equal to this one, or -1 if no match is found.
